programme.title: House Of Horrors
programme.desc: In Gloucester, England, Rosemary Letts meets 27-year old Frederick West, married father of two daughters, on her 15th birthday. Soon after they move in together, one of his daughters and his wife disappear. By now, Rosemary and Fred have children of their own who tease that "if you disobey Mom or Dad, you'll end up 'under the patio'." After a detective overhears this, police discover a body under the patio and another eight in the cellar.

programme.title: Lying In Wait
programme.desc: A mystery man abducts Colette Aram in Nottinghamshire, England, throwing her into the back of a stolen car and strangling her. Twenty-five years pass until police find an unlikely suspect, who is now a married father of four children.

programme.title: Murder In Glacier National Park
programme.desc: Questions arise surrounding the death of a missing newlywed when the body is found at the bottom of a Montana waterfall just 8 days after the wedding. A blindfold is found, and police question whether or not the victim fell... or was pushed.

programme.title: Murderer At The Morgue
programme.desc: A young marriage ends in suicide – with an elaborate homage to the movie "American Beauty." When the victim's family presses the police to order an autopsy, their investigation is hindered by the revelation that all the organs have been removed for donation, and the body is going to be cremated.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: It's not a Steelers game without the food. Chef Cory Hughes and Chef Les Murphy face off in the kitchen gridiron to see who can score the best Steelers tailgating dishes.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: Runner-in-Chief Jeff Dengate, presents inspiring runner stories from around the country. Meet runners from Colorado, New Jersey, Kentucky and Pennsylvania who are making a difference.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Cristina Quackenbush of Milkfish takes on Chef Jennifer Cole of Laurel Oak in a blindfold battle of international influences! They may not have matched on a dating app, but in the kitchen it’s a match-up for the ages.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Celebrate some of the Midwest's holiday favorites. Where scotcheroos take center stage, snicker salads delight, and the pink stuff surprises the pallet.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Karla, a devoted mother and doting grandmother has had her fair share of obstacles from two bouts of cancer to caring for her husband and daughter. Karla embarks on a much needed day of pampering, seeking solace and self-care.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In Milwaukee, 19-year-old Sade Robinson has gone missing, and her car is found torched. A trail of evidence across the city shocks the community and leaves her family searching for justice.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: It's the day after Thanksgiving 1992 in Drake, Iowa, and few want to cook. Locals head to the popular Drake Diner instead. In front of a packed restaurant, an armed man shoots and kills two diner employees. Is the town as peaceful as some say?

programme.title: Refugees Welcome: A Story of Immigration to America’s Heartland
programme.desc: Refugees Welcome documents how one Governor’s brave decision to welcome refugees during the Vietnam War had far reaching repercussions not only for the country but, generations later, for the fate of his own family.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: An Omaha home pottery artist, and a spider web-catching jewelry maker in Boston.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Three indigenous makers set out to create a traditional gorget representing their ancestry and Oklahoma City. Tensions rise when an unanticipated addition is brought to the challenge forcing on-the-fly changes. Whose design will soar above the rest?

programme.title: Weathering the Storm

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: When bones are discovered burned in a rural New Hampshire community, a horrific story begins to emerge…one that exposes the secrets of a charming killer living among them.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Milwaukee was built on a foundation of social clubs and communal effort. Former Emmy Award winning WISN reporter Shar Borg shows Greg her favorite community building businesses and activities.

programme.title: Breaking Chains
programme.desc: Follow the journey of a sex trafficking survivor who makes her way through Change Court, a program that helps trafficking victims get off the streets, receive counseling, job training and get their criminal records expunged.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Join Greg and Maryam Durani as they explore Milwaukee from the eyes of their newest neighbors. Greg volunteers with kids at the library, hears powerful stories, and bakes specialty bread from Maryam's homeland. Don't miss this inspiring episode!

programme.title: Local Love

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Where else can you take a detailed look at Uranus without a fancy NASA telescope, discover a mysterious underground lake, and pretend you’re a fugitive leaping from a cliff before plunging into emerald colored waters? We’ve got answers.

programme.title: Stitch

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teenager vanishes from her home one fall morning in 1999. Her body is discovered 17 days later, seven miles away. It takes more than 15 years for the heartbreaking truth to come out.
